data.what_is:
Acoustic Campaign is a multichannel marketing platform built for customer-obsessed brands. We help businesses connect with customers through sophisticated customer journeys, over a variety of channels - email, web, mobile push, SMS, MMS, WhatsApp, social media, print and more. The offering includes various capabilities, from everyday marketing automation and campaign execution to highly sophisticated journey orchestration, journey analytics, segmentation, personalization, high-end content creation and digital experience analytics.
 
With our open and flexible platform, marketers can connect to any data source and segment their data for hyper-targeting. Our intuitive, zero-code UI and hyper-personalization capabilities empower marketers to independently run multichannel, personalized campaigns without relying on data teams or coding to make it happen. 

Unlike complex and costly enterprise offerings, we offer the same sophisticated  enterprise-grade solutions for all marketers. And unlike 'point solutions' or email service providers, we enable you to engage with consumers across multiple channels in a single platform. We help marketers surface actionable insights and personalize communications as you begin to scale.
 
Acoustic Marketing Cloud puts the marketer in the driver's seat to help customers increase long-term customer engagement and drive revenue growth. Our customers include top brands and Fortune 500 companies. For more information, visit acoustic.com/products. 

Capabilities:  
Journey Orchestration 
Email 
SMS/MMS 
WhatsApp 
Mobile push  
Content Management System 
Customer Journey Insights 
Integrations 
Segmentation 
Social Audiences  
Drag and Drop Forms Composer 
Drag and Drop Multichannel Composer 
Transactional Messaging 
Data Layer
data.product_description: Acoustic Campaign is a digital marketing technology provider that unifies marketing automation, email, mobile, and social.- As an entire company focused on the marketer, Acoustic is the only marketing cloud that provides insights, planning, and execution in one platform.- When marketers aren't just looking for a vendor, but a partner, they choose Acoustic.- With the trust of leading brands Acoustic is a proven platform, reimagined.

pricing_plans.plan_description: Great for marketers who have outgrown limited marketing automation tools and want to take customer engagement to the next level.
Great for marketers who want to scale up their marketing efforts and better leverage data to grow revenue.
For sophisticated marketers who want to maximize ROI from marketing and grow their enterprise into a leading brand.
plan_features: Everything included in Essentials and Standard Editions

features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Based on 68 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file.

features.name: Integration APIs
features.content: Based on 56 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Application Programming Interface - Specification for how the application communicates with other software.  API's typically enable integration of data, logic, objects, etc with other software applications.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: Based on 48 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product.

features.name: Customization
features.content: Based on 64 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. System provides sufficient customization to meet business requirements

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Based on 62 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: Based on 64 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Based on 36 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: Based on 46 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Based on 61 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.

features.name: Output Document Generation
features.content: Based on 41 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Allows adminstrators to create templates that enable users to quickly generate dynamic documents in various formats based on the data stored in the application.

features.name: Building and Personalizing Emails
features.content: Based on 148 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Create and design emails with an editor; manage templates; personalize dynamically

features.name: Sending Outbound Emails
features.content: Based on 150 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Create targeted lists, schedule and manage bulk email sending.

features.name: Manage Email Deliverability
features.content: Based on 147 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Ensure inbox delivery. Includes opt-in management, bounce handling, unsubscribe processing, suppression lists, email preview, spam checking, link validation, and delivery monitoring.

features.name: Automated Email Responses
features.content: Based on 130 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Set up automated nurturing emails based on events, online activities, and lead scores

features.name: Landing Pages and Forms
features.content: Based on 117 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Build customized landing pages and lead capture forms for specific marketing campaigns to maximize conversion and to capture the right qualifying information.

features.name: Dynamic Content
features.content: Based on 123 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Dynamically customize emails, forms, and landing pages for specific segments of customers and prospects.

features.name: A/B Testing
features.content: Based on 125 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Test alternate versions of emails, landing pages, and forms. Learn what works, maximize response rates, and increase conversion.

features.name: Mobile Optimized
features.content: Based on 115 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Support mobile-optimized emails, online forms, and landing pages.

features.name: Search Tracking and Optimization
features.content: Based on 95 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Track performance of keywords and links in major search engines.  Measure search rankings and performance.  Improve page-level SEO with tools to diagnose and improve page performance.  Integrate with Google AdWords.

features.name: Marketing Lead Database
features.content: Based on 101 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. A marketing lead database is the system of record for your most important marketing asset: your leads and contacts. Includes a view of all marketing interactions between each prospect and your company, including website visits, email clicks, scoring changes, and data updates/history.

features.name: Data Quality Management
features.content: Based on 102 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Data quality consists of deduplication, cleansing, and appending your marketing database.

features.name: Segmentation
features.content: Based on 112 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Segment your database and build list of target leads and contacts.  Filter on demographic and company attributes (title, company size, location) as well as behavioral filters and CRM information.

features.name: Lead Scoring and Grading
features.content: Based on 82 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Automatically qualify and score leads based on demographics as well as prospect online behaviors, including recency and frequency. Assign your own weights to determine lead scores for prioritization.

features.name: Lead Nurturing
features.content: Based on 92 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Automate drip marketing campaigns that send relevant messages over time, based on prospect behaviors and pre-defined campaign steps.

features.name: Online Behavior Tracking
features.content: Based on 88 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Track which emails a prospect opens and clicks, what web-pages they visit, what keywords they use, even what they say on social networks.

features.name: Automated Alerts and Tasks
features.content: Based on 82 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Create tasks automatically and provide real-time sales alerts over email, RSS or mobile device.

features.name: CRM Lead Integration
features.content: Based on 83 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Sync lead, contact, account, and opportunity information with your CRM system.

features.name: Program ManagementView full feature definition
features.content: Based on 103 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Manage marketing campaigns and programs across multiple channels, including online ads, video campaigns, mobile, virtual events, and social media. Create and optimize program assets such as landing pages, emails, campaigns, and lists. Track program objectives, results, and costs to assess the program ROI.

features.name: Event / Webinar Marketing
features.content: Based on 80 Acoustic Campaign reviews. Streamline the entire event process, including personalized invitations, registration, reminders, and post-event follow-up.  Integrate with online meeting tools like WebEx, Adobe Connect, GoToWebinar.

features.name: Calendaring
features.content: Based on 65 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Maintain a marketing calendar across multiple groups. Manage the calendar for the entire marketing department, from promotions to content to PR.

features.name: Budgeting
features.content: Based on 54 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Manage all aspects of marketing investments, including assigning top-down budgets to various groups and divisions, planning marketing spending across programs, tracking open-to-spend, ensuring budget compliance, coordinating work-flows and permissions, and reconciling plans with actual invoices.

features.name: Social Listening
features.content: As reported in 58 Acoustic Campaign reviews. Monitor what leads and contacts say on sites such as Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn, blogs, and online communities.  Incorporate into your lead and customer DB and use social insights to segment prospects.  Trigger campaigns, and update lead scores.

features.name: Social Sharing
features.content: Based on 73 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Add intelligent social share buttons to your campaigns and content.  Track who is sharing your content and driving conversions.

features.name: Social Campaigns
features.content: Based on 65 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Schedule automated posts to one or more social accounts; use or integrate with URL shortening services; and measure likes, comments, replies, and retweets.

features.name: Social Media Engagement
features.content: Social apps including polls, sweepstakes, and referral programs can enhance audience engagement.  Include these on your website, landing pages, Facebook pages, and emails. This feature was mentioned in 66 Acoustic Campaign reviews.

features.name: Social Media Advertising
features.content: Based on 60 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Amplify brand and community stories; Reach customers by social profile and activity; Optimize social ad campaigns in real-time

features.name: Basic Reporting
features.content: Based on 131 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Access pre-built and custom reports and dashboards to measure leads by source/campaign/month, email performance, landing page performance, and web and social activity. Create report subscriptions that can automatically send updates to your team and executives.

features.name: Web Analytics
features.content: Based on 103 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Track which pages prospects and customers visit and how often they come back.  Capture the history in database for lead scoring and sales intelligence. Use anonymous company look-up to identify anonymous visitors.  Send alerts to sales reps of which of their prospects and customers web activity.

features.name: ROI Analytics
features.content: Based on 80 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Measure leads, prospects generated, pipeline, revenue, investment, and ROI by marketing channel or program. The result is that you can see which marketing investments are generating the greatest return and get visibility into how marketing budget should be allocated going forward.

features.name: Revenue Analytics
features.content: Based on 78 Acoustic Campaign reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Analyze how leads flow through the funnel by measuring stage to stage conversion rates and velocity.  Allocate pipeline and revenue credit among all the marketing activities that have successfully touched an opportunity as it moves through the pipeline.

features.name: SEO / Keyword Analytics
features.content: Monitor and track how you rank for relevant keywords on major search engines and compare your overall performance to competitors. This feature was mentioned in 67 Acoustic Campaign reviews.

The platform helped to a great extent in streamlining the campaign workflow.

The purpose of the evaluation was to orchestrate & bring structure to our marketing campaigns which otherwise were run in silos with limited visibility of cross-platform performance. The platform helped to a great extent in streamlining the campaign workflow.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
The platform is intuitive and unlike other platforms, they do not totally change the layout every year, making you have to relearn everything.
The range of features is very comprehensive from database creation and multiple options within that, to queries, to landing page, form and email/SMS creation with numerous templates for emails. Acoustic is very flexible scoring options and combination of scoring types from BANT to behavioral, and very detailed reporting.  Personalization and dynamic content available for forms, landing pages and emails. One can also preview and test if personalization and dynamic content is working by entering names or emails from the database.

The queries are very flexible, one can do firmographic or demographic queries from the database fields, use relational tables and behavioral queries based on interaction or lack of with emails, the website, specific landing pages and the automation programs/campaigns. One can also combine all these different types of queries.

The programs interface was recently changed and an improvement in look and feel.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
Minor quirks with the WYSWIG, it would be nice to have split source and design views, often have to get into HTML code to change something WYSWIG cant do

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Acoustic to train students in campaign and marketing automation using custom data set and company campaigns.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
- The ability to create programs and queries. It's easy to create them and start something new from scratch, it's also fun with the new blueprints, that show you all the steps people are making inside your journey.
- I like that you can create a group inside Acoustic and define who will be the approval user, with that, nobody can send e-mails, without the right person to approve. It's the best way to prevent any "wrong" e-mail sent.
- The new performance insight is also something very great. You can define whatever the contact source you wanna see results and build them from scratch, with the best elements for you.
- The possibiliy to take out of one query, people that are already in another query is a time saver for some big projects. You don't need to recreate all the rules you made.
- The new message composer is awesome. The drag and drop save so much time for my team, that have 0 knownledge in html. It makes easir for them to work faster.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
- The UI. Some sections reminds me of Windows 2000 and are not that easy to use.
- Some words and translation to portuguese, could be a little better.
- There are limitations in the new blueprints, with just 200 elements. Sometimes I wanna build bigger programs and I just can't.
- Integrations are also not that easy, it's possible to make them, but they are a little difficult. Like integrating with Google Analytics, wish you could make a one-button click integration.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Know your business and find what is right for it.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automatic comunications with my contacts.
We've got over 80 thousand contacts to reach, in different situtations.
The best is that we can separate them and communicate in the right moment, without loosing track of it.
Avoiding human mistakes. When we work with humans sending campaigns and comunications, you're stuck with somebody mood.
With a machine, you just need to set-up one time, test and watch the results. It's really easy.

all_reviews.review_title: Outdated Interface for HIGH COST and Messy Repeatedly Acquired Company Structure Creates Headaches
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Acoustic used to be Silverpop, then got acquired and became IBM Marketing Cloud, then got acquired and became Acoustic as we know it today. I am a current user and have been using this software for 5+ years.

The interface for sending emails, data reporting, and overall tracking of a customer journey is outdated... as though the last development on this web app stopped in 2001. I'm sure at some point in the past 10 yrs Silverpop was innovative and ahead of the time, but TODAY, Acoustic is a burdensome software that is EXPENSIVE and not even good at what it is intended to do. Again, the UI and the reporting scream of early 2000s. They are not intuitive and you have to bend over backward in data reporting to figure out the global customer journey in email campaigns.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
I've covered this in what I do like because there really is not much. It's an old software the people think must be great because corporate America used the IBM version. The truth is that this company is VERY FAR behind in technology for a marketing cloud software and you would be better served to go with SalesForce or MailChimp if you want high tech marketing campaign software.

It's nothing personal against Acoustic, but this company is literally acquired and bought out every few years since I've been saddled with using the email marketing technology. For 5 years I've seen very little innovation and the overall software is clunky and requires a savvy user to operate well. Again, if I could go to my dream provider for marketing cloud email campaigns it would be MailChimp or SalesForce. Skip Acoustic or whatever it's going to be called when it's next acquired in a year or two...

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
Clunky software, outdated interfaces, horrible html editor that adds improperly formatted html to emails. Also, part of being acquired yearly is that Acoustic account management is not well organized and a revolving door. Get ready for surprise billing and strange charges but no account manager to help figure it out.

What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Email creation is very easy. Setup for the database is great. Automation is easy to create. API connectivity to the database is relatively easy.
We have the best Client Success Director working with us. Always open to questions and can answer most questions. He is always looking out for our best interest and not just trying to sell us products we don't really need.
Support is great. They helped us get off a blacklist and offered very practical advice on how to stay off them.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
There's no way to organize emails by campaign.
Reporting is not as good as other platforms although performance insights is pretty good. There's a bit of a learning curve on that though.
I wish regular reporting had a device report. This has to be done separately through email insights.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
It will do pretty much everything you need it do in terms of email marketing.
The support is there if you need it as well.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were blacklisted and deliverability support helped us resolve these issues.
We also had a problem because there was a company that was blocking our emails. They found the issue and addressed it quickly.
Our Client Success Director helps us with any problems we have. If he doesn't know he directs us to the right person. We had issues with billing with IBM and he helped to resolve this.

all_reviews.review_title: Acoustic campaign is a very innovative SaaS-based cross channel digital marketing platform.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Acoustic campaign is an excellent platform for digital marketing. The app provides a multitude of programs including email marketing campaigns which helps marketers to manage and go through them with great ease preventing high trafficking problems. Automation is a great feature which helps organizing the data on daily basis and saves the trouble of piling up the to do work. The integration with sales force is particularly commendable. Mass mailing is very easy. It provides great reporting and integration. Also helps the marketers to set up welcome campaigns, push campaigns, sms campaigns, social media campaigns. Scoring models, personalization, landing pages, community forums are key features which cover almost every aspect relating to digital marketing an creates an all in one plce platform. It has quite an efficient management of contact lists which makes interpretation very accessible and helps to keep record of their record. The platform is very safe to use and is also very reliable. Provides very satisfactory customer support. Online training is also easy to comprehend.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
Syncing of data with silverpop is somewhat difficult and requires effort to navigate through the app to get to your requirement. Administrator alerts should be added to notify the user of any error. The features in reporting should be improved. The organizing of data base is a bit cumbersome. The automated apps should have a better testing functionality so that the tracking becomes less manual and help save a lot of time. The interface is a bit boring.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is a very comprehensive tool for which provides excellent marketing campaigns to customers. Suitable for medium and large sized companies. And is easy to operate as well.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Acoustic has bought over all the great functionality from Silverpop and more recently IBM. The platform boasts many innovative features to enable to user to develop a "true" omnichannel CRM strategy. The integrations with platforms such as Salesforce, Facebook and WordPress are fairly painless.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
When having more complex integrations and use cases (unless you have a whole tech team) can present challenges and may require some consulting hours. This can become fairly costly and can take a reasonable amount of time. The platform can be a little "techy", I personally like this but others may prefer user experience over functionality.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are solving the omnichannel conundrum, for many companies, this is still a buzzword, a long term goal. By incorporating email, SMS, web push, site pop-ups, personalised blocks on the site, social media and direct mail into a CRM strategy we are able to communicate with all our customers via a channel that is best for them and provide a hyper-personalised experience.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
Having a consistent responsive design can be problematic. It would benefit from Google CSS inliner tool. Importing templates could be improved dramatically. Some opt-in and out tools need revamping as many purging and such don't work as advertised.  Landing pages and forms need a major overhaul. Currently, we have to do all sorts of gyrations to defeat robots because there is no way to secure landing pages/forms that Acoustic. Adding in a customizable Captcha system is also a must.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
If you want an ESP that is going somewhere, you can't go wrong with IBM Watson Campaign Automation. They give you a lot of tools for very reasonable price.

all_reviews.review_title: Functionality showing its age. In need of an update.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Basic email automation functionality works well, as well as the ability to write custom queries with any number of criteria. Salesforce CRM app also works well for syncing contact records back and forth between the ESP and the CRM. Pricing model doesn't penalize you for the size of your database.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
Functionality lags far behind competitors. Regularly find bugs in reporting, automation, backend process, and other areas. Unable associate scoring models with more than one database. Support is hit or miss, depending on who you get (the original Silverpop reps are the best and most helpful). Documentation is also severely lacking when it comes to features and tools within the platform. I usually end up having to test and learn when something new is rolled out in order to find it's limitations and quirks.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Could be a solid choice for a company starting out with email automation, however, take into account the cost of competitors and how fast you're growing as it quickly becomes unable to scale to larger more complex solutions. Updates can be fairly manual depending on how many email templates you have. Reporting is also difficult due to different variations the platform has rolled out, as well as a good amount of bugs and oddities in the reporting systems.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
Direct to consumer email automation as well as B2B email automation. Scale is fairly easy to achieve once you've mastered the platform.

all_reviews.review_title: Watson on its journey for the customer
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
While the product has been made for a very specific purpose, I like that my team is able to tap into the flexibility that currently exists to do things that the software was not made for. Every team is not going to be used the exact same way so being able to have it fit whatever your need, for the most part, is really valuable.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
As an administrator for the software, I set up its use for over 120 different users for over 30 different areas of our organization. The way the updates are occurring and how you can or used to be able to section off the different areas was key, as all users need to pull segments from the larger pool of data and allow us as administrators to run company-wide reporting over the 30 subsets. As it is moving forward the ability to keep this segmentation is continuously compromised by both Performance Insights, Org settings, and Matson Marketing Assistant. Any time anything new comes into play we have to translate the changes into a language our users understand and figure out how to safegaurd the other areas of data and content that not everyone needs access to.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Make sure your data and infastructure are claen or you will not be able to realize the full benefit of the tool.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
My company is now able to send global messaging internally in the case of a natural disaster or emergent medical outbreak, such as the Zika virus. It also allowed us to automate messaging for the employees that are new to our organization and provide them with the information that they need to thrive in their first few weeks or months in our company, such as signing up for retirement, coding, and setting up meetings with their direct manager on a regular cadence.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
I really like being able to use the product without having to hire a consultant.  WCA give me the autonomy I want to be able to perform my daily job functions.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
There's nothing that I really dislike.  There are things that I would like to evolve and IBM provides a mechanism to submit ideas.  These ideas are actually reviewed and you'll find their comments on your ideas.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are automating email and SMS to audiences that were untouched before.  This cost a lot of manpower.  Now through automated programs we are able to re-purpose those man hours to customers who are most likely to convert and let automated programs take care of the rest.  We have also been able to customize and personalize at scale which we haven't previously been able to do for our 60+ brands.

The UI leaves a lot to be desired, and certain design (such as the slider bar for setting deployment time) left room for user error. Page load times during the "set deployment" phase were so long from time to time that the page itself would time out.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
Managing all newsletter deployments/tests for the content, marketing, and events arms of our business. Better organization re loading templates, condensing files, etc.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool with wide range of capabilities
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
wide range of capabilities including email, sms, mobile push, automated programs.
New development in the UI is good and features quickly catching up with the older UI.
Ability to embed 'Contact Insights' into 3rd party web sites/apps is very useful.
The Watson Marketing Assistant is a cool feature which provides easy access to some very useful metrics.
Modular templates has proved to be a useful feature for our clients, allowing them to self serve.

For more technical requirements, you can use the provided APIs and also send transactional emails.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
Integration with IBM Campaign is a little clunky on the Campaign side.
Reporting is not great and the screen has a fixed size which is annoying.
Not a lot of 3rd party integrations which is very unfortunate.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
great as both a stand alone solution as well as integrated into IBM Campaign.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
our clients are sending highly personalised emails and some have integrated into IBM Campaign.
Some clients have a variety of modular templates which makes them more self sufficient, saving on agency costs.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
I dislike that a lot of the new generation don't really know much about the IBM Company and how the office systems as simple as a typewriter have changed how we communicated, now we have digital communication via the internet, and mobile devices, which opens us up to getting the information out faster, but sometimes to our detriment, because the youth of today don't have a filter in how they communicate their values, ideas and thoughts on the social media networks. I wish that they IBM Watson would create an operating system that would eliminate the junk.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
There really isn't much I actually like about it.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
It's very buggy and the bugs get worse with every update. The landing page feature is very backwards in its code use.  The proprietary code added to the HTML makes it that in order to change a link you have to actually remove the link (which sometimes can be done with a right click, but the latest bug only allows that to work on certain portions of the page, meaning you have to delete the text and retype it) and then relink it because there's an ID number that will remain the same and therefore make the same file download, despite you changing which file you wanted for the download link.  There are other obnoxious bugs that have popped up, including others where you right click to edit something and the dialog box appears further down the page, meaning you have to scroll to find it.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Avoid.  It's buggy and cumbersome and seems to only be getting worse.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
Its basic functions work. Emails get sent at the right time.  You can simultaneously work on multiple items in different tabs (i.e. upload files to the asset library while working on an email template).  There are just so many bugs that it's obnoxious to work with.

There are other obnoxious bugs that have popped up, including others where you right click to edit something and the dialog box appears further down the page, meaning you have to scroll to find it.

all_reviews.review_title: Not an integrated product, does not live up to sales promised
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
I like that WCA can send out campaigns for text, push notification and email, and a lot of this can be done through campaigns. It also has a very flexible rule creation capability for dynamic content and subject lines (for email only). The new user interface looks good, but is not fully developed.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
The transact and engage products are not at all integrated into one user interface. The legacy products are sloppily brought together and don't even interact in all the ways they should. The limitations of the database structure make it very difficult to conduct all your campaigns the way that sales tells you that you can. The new UI does not allow you to take advantage of all the features so you are stuck in legacy interface. This is far from a next generation product suite.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Make sure you speak to a specialist before committing to this product. It is often bundled along with other IBM products and customers purchase it for the cost savings. However the work required to make it work can be expensive, and the marketing automation features are clumsy.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
WCA allows us to create repeatable programs for users that simplify the marketing for clients marketers. But most campaigns also require developer support and using the APIS to accomplish. Other competitive products do a much better job at creating a seamless UI.

review_question_answers.answer: I like that WCA can send out campaigns for text, push notification and email, and a lot of this can be done through campaigns. It also has a very flexible rule creation capability for dynamic content and subject lines (for email only). The new user interface looks good, but is not fully developed.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
review_question_answers.answer: The transact and engage products are not at all integrated into one user interface. The legacy products are sloppily brought together and don't even interact in all the ways they should. The limitations of the database structure make it very difficult to conduct all your campaigns the way that sales tells you that you can. The new UI does not allow you to take advantage of all the features so you are stuck in legacy interface. This is far from a next generation product suite.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
I like their API which allows you to add/update/retrieve data with ease. Their programs (automation) functions are easy to set up as long as you have all of the data you need.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
I've used them for over 10 years (started as Silverpop) and I've always been able to figure out issues faster than their tech services team. I'd often have to tell them why something didn't work the way they thought it should.

Low learning curve to get off the ground sending campaigns. Good support team with quick response times.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
Limitations on building queries. Retrieving exported files requires lots of digging through various folder structures. all_reviews.review_title: WCA: the most flexible tool for DIY enterprise communications
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
There are a number of features, such as the template builder and contact-level mailing reports which my team uses on a continual basis. When working with these simplest parts of WCA, the thing that stands apart is the plethora of hidden functionality. These range from free Litmus and SpamAssassin testing to Hotmail and sender score deliverability reporting.

Of course, there are also more advanced features. WCA supports the creation of exceedingly intricate programs (automated/triggered series), it ties into mobile and social efforts natively, and can serves admirably well for lead scoring, lead routing, engagement reporting, content management and delivery, and a number of other functions.

After working with this tool for several years I'm still exploring new functionality which is simply unavailable from most other ESPs/ campaign management tools/API handlers/+. WCA wears many hats and makes it simple for my team to expand our communications program while driving synergy across the company.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
While the training, knowledge center, and various blogs/social groups have a wealth of knowledge, the onboarding process (when I started using WCA) was very much a "we'll throw you in the pool and you'll learn how to swim" experience.

I'd recommend weighting curiosity heavily in your hiring decision when looking for someone to use this system--it's a poor fit for those wanting a done for them solution. As a client across multiple orgs, this need for self sufficiency has extended to customer support, sales, and technical support.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Determine your objectives upfront and ensure they're aligned with what WCA offers.

Find an experienced partner to train you and show you the ropes.

Do your homework throughout the onboarding and ramp-up period. I strongly recommend the certification training offered for WCA; to date, I've found it to be the best source of information about the platform.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've dramatically expanded our usage of WCA to reach our customers around the world. Few solutions would have allowed us to evolve as gracefully from blasting communications in 1 country to individual conversations with customers on 6 continents.

Along the way we've built APIs with our proprietary systems and a range of specialized tools to tie WCA into CRM data, product data, sales data, support data, etc. It handles the load with ease.

all_reviews.review_title: Robust and Progressive with Single View of Contacts
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
IBM Content Management gives us the ability to create multiple databases with relational content. It can be updated in virtual real-time, which gives us a ton of opportunity to be immediate in our proactive messaging.   It integrates across web as well, so we are able to integrate user behaviors on our websites to make our messaging even more relevant and timely. Users have the ability to generate a ton of templates, which you can optionally lock to allow select users to update copy without being able to alter other elements of the email.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
It has one heck of a learning curve - especially if you are not familiar with database management. It took us more than the 90 day onboarding to get our first communications out. Granted, some of that was a matter of trying to implement while also managing several other demands, so be prepared to dedicate more time to learning, testing, and tweaking before seeing your first fruits.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Do your homework to make sure it is the right fit for your culture and expertise. It's a great platform with tremendous potential. It may be overwhelming; putting in the effort and attention it requires, will make it a powerful tool and your biggest asset for success.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are getting highly personalized, timely and more relevant in communicating with our audiences. We also have set up approval workflows to ensure proper proofing is done before broadcast. Also, we are deploying A/B testing to optimize our messages for best open and conversation rates.

all_reviews.review_title: No longer a valid Email Vendor
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
We signed up under Silverpop before they were integrated into IBM. Great marketing, promotions, and options. They are now a marketing firm only.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
The problem is they are supposed to be an email vendor, who no longer knows how email systems work. They are supposed to recognize when email addresses expire by "hard-bounces" and then clean them out of our email lists. Their system stopped doing this and ignored the errors. The closed emails were eventually sent to honey pots such as Spamhaus who -did not- report us as spam due to our reputation and history with them, but instead contacted Silverpop to alert them of their error. Silverpop didn't understand and rather than fix their routines, turned off the send on our account, send us an communication indicating bots had filled our email lists with invalid contacts, blamed us for issues, and denied everything. This was on top of the fact that over the 3 years we have been with them, the key features they sold us on still have not materialized and been made available to my company. They continue to report -0- errors in transmissions, refused email accounts, and other hard-bounces  on 1.5M email addresses on a daily basis. Their service failures and outages are routine, and they seem to reboot the servers rather than track the issues down.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
They will work, if you are technically inclined, can invest the time in debugging and understanding their platform and your emails are not mission critical.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
Delivering our digital periodicals to customers on demand.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
IBM Marketing Cloud (Silverpop) is a robust marketing automation tool that I use as an agency for many clients across multiple industries and verticals. We like their programs functionality that allows you to drag and drop steps (emails, lead routes etc) and modify your database based off behavioral information. Our clients have been very impressed with how useful the tool is for lead nurturing, landing page creation, and web tracking.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
I dislike the reporting as it very limited in terms of customization (but they are working on improving this). I also wish that some features were included like creating an automated data export from the user interface or creating super customized reports that can be generated on a daily basis. A/B testing in programs isn't a current functionality that we'd like to have as well.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're helping customers deliver more personalized messaging to their customers that is behaviorally triggered and customized to each individual. We're also able to automate data processes that were previously manual and have helped bridge the gap between sales and marketing.

The email marketing aspect of it has seen the most love in recently releases with an updated UI and easy-to-manipulate templates.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
Still very wonky due to the old UI mix-ins with the new UI and their potentially capable but nearly unusable Landing Page Designer falls short more often than it should for a full release product.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Keep in mind the heavy on-boarding process as with any major marketing platform. Implore IBM to dedicate technical and non-technical people to assist in the on-boarding and always write down all questions to ensure they're answered - you'll inevitably encounter the same problem you initially resolved and quickly forgot the solution. That's simply because the platform is so robust and so complex, very few would be able to comprehend it all, retained.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've witnessed better overall reporting than our previous tool, MailChimp in both landing page conversions and email.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Silverpop has a robust selection of tools. The only problem is that many of them are very difficult to find.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
This platform has the worst UX of any system I've ever had to learn. The menus don't make any sense. Headings aren't categories, they are menu items, but don't look clickable. In order to get statistics on platform and client of users, you don't look in email reports, you look in Email Insights, then click a tiny tab at the top, and then you have to assign an outgoing campaign to it. This is not collected passively. There are an extraordinary number of weird issues like this. Read some Steve Krug, people. Usability is important.

More than anything, I dislike IBM Silverpop for breaking my e-mail templates. I was lucky enough to discover a new bug in which Silverpop strips the height and width properties from HTML elements. This makes it impossible to add images at double resolution for retinal displays, and makes responsive design where images may expand or contract extremely difficult. This issue only affects users of Outlook 2013 and other versions that process with Microsoft Word, but that is a huge share of the market--especially the contributor market for nonprofits.

This seems to be an isolated bug, but a bug that IBM's customer service refused to acknowledge for about a month until I recorded myself demonstrating the issue. Even then, IBM customer service tried to throw me under the bus to my supervisor, claiming it was an HTML issue. The issue is that Silverpop is rewriting my HTML document, not that the document was written wrong. Now the issue has finally reached their Tier 2 bug gurus, but the damage to my reputation at my office has been done.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Use another product to reach your market.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are trying to increase revenue for donations, memberships, and programs. We are successfully using IBM Silverpop to segment our hundreds of thousands of email subscribers with targeted messages. Our responsive template, even, has proven a success in increasing revenue across all departments.

review_question_answers.answer: Silverpop has a robust selection of tools. The only problem is that many of them are very difficult to find.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
review_question_answers.answer:
This platform has the worst UX of any system I've ever had to learn. The menus don't make any sense. Headings aren't categories, they are menu items, but don't look clickable. In order to get statistics on platform and client of users, you don't look in email reports, you look in Email Insights, then click a tiny tab at the top, and then you have to assign an outgoing campaign to it. This is not collected passively. There are an extraordinary number of weird issues like this. Read some Steve Krug, people. Usability is important.

More than anything, I dislike IBM Silverpop for breaking my e-mail templates. I was lucky enough to discover a new bug in which Silverpop strips the height and width properties from HTML elements. This makes it impossible to add images at double resolution for retinal displays, and makes responsive design where images may expand or contract extremely difficult. This issue only affects users of Outlook 2013 and other versions that process with Microsoft Word, but that is a huge share of the market--especially the contributor market for nonprofits.

This seems to be an isolated bug, but a bug that IBM's customer service refused to acknowledge for about a month until I recorded myself demonstrating the issue. Even then, IBM customer service tried to throw me under the bus to my supervisor, claiming it was an HTML issue. The issue is that Silverpop is rewriting my HTML document, not that the document was written wrong. Now the issue has finally reached their Tier 2 bug gurus, but the damage to my reputation at my office has been done.

review_question_answers.answer: Use another product to reach your market.

review_question_answers.answer: We are trying to increase revenue for donations, memberships, and programs. We are successfully using IBM Silverpop to segment our hundreds of thousands of email subscribers with targeted messages. Our responsive template, even, has proven a success in increasing revenue across all departments.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
I dislike the some of the segmentation options in the IBM SilverPop platform. You're not able to create simple segments of customers that opened an email or clicked an email over a period of time. What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
SilverPop has allowed us fair amount of flexibility for our mass emails to customers and have an open API that has allowed us to plug in other tools where IBM's Silverpop has failed.

all_reviews.review_title: Great MAP with new features being added in quick succession
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
IBM (formerly Silverpop) has grown incredibly quickly since their acquisition. Previously, the platform did email marketing well (great deliverability score, intuitive list management, and nice send process), but since the acquisition, the product has really come to life. The product has been updated to have a more modern look, and the send process has gotten increasingly better. The software is quite robust and we have begun to use more of the features on the platform than we did previously (Analytics, Journey Designer, building landing pages, etc.).

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
Historically, the software has been great for trained personnel, but because it is en Enterprise solution, it is much less intuitive than other ESPs on the market (if we to just compare the email portion of the software). The email templates provided are okay, but aren't very versatile. You get one template per category (transactional, ecommerce, thank you, welcome, etc.). Until recently, IBM didn't offer any pre-built templates to use with their editor.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We began using Silverpop as an ESP but are now using it more as a MAP now that IBM has made several improvements. We are soon going to be able to integrate IBM with Dynamics, which will be incredibly helpful to our Sales team to see how MQLs have interacted online with our organization.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
IBM Marketing Cloud/Watson Campaign Automation (formerly known as Silverpop), creates a lot of opportunity to cater personalized messages to a defined audience. Aside from personalization, IBM Marketing Cloud allows you to automate messages, which enables your business to increase its productivity.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
1. Content Builder is not friendly for marketers, even with predefined templates.
2. Forms do not allow you to use relational table data and are not robust compared to other form builders
3. Landing pages have no predefined options for BASIC MARKETING LANDING PAGES that can be modified by MARKETING PEOPLE.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
If you are looking for a more sophisticated marketing automation system, this will fit your needs. However, if you want something that is going to be perfect out of the box, this is not your solution. You will need to do in-depth trainings to understand everything the tool has to offer.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are engaging our customers through automated, localized campaigns. Once we integrate our CRM, we will be able to create a full customer profile to target more specifically and nurture our customers in a more meaningful way.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
The IBM marketing cloud has plenty of acclaimed features, but what we like the most is its integration with Silverpop. We are an email-heavy company that relies direct one-on-one communications and IBM Marketing Cloud and its API help us integration everything into our internal, customized CRM. Contact management has never been easier, and monitoring the effectiveness of all our other marketing efforts have also become a breeze.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
The main complaint would be the lack of consideration to user experience (UX). Of course, we could just be an outlier, but our team struggled initially during the onboarding process. The menus and descriptions in the backend dashboard are not particularly easy to comprehend at first, and there were many instances where we just scratched our heads wondering why IBM chose to configure certain functions / dashboards the way they did.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Take advantage of the provided onboarding process. It will take several of your team members to fully immersive themselves and truly understand the system to ensure a smooth operation moving forward.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
Over the past 3 decades, our company has marketed our products and services through various mediums. In today's digital age and emphasis on providing what your customer wants, rather than what you want them to want, we needed a comprehensive solution that could integrate all of our marketing in one place. The IBM Marketing Cloud has certainly done so, nearly all of our marketing has various touch points with IBM's software at this point, and it has made our jobs much easier.

Highly recommended above anything else. The ROI is immeasurable. Couldn't be any happier with the robust capabilities. My team has accomplished incredible feats.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
Would love to see some type of Outlook 365 integration in the future. Sometimes the reporting capabilities are hard to export and edit in spreadsheets/powerpoint presentations. Usually that's not a big issue and can be played around with to achieve the end goal.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
The mobile marketing component is the best part of this product. It's worth the purchase for mobile alone.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
Handling inbound/outbound marketing leads for several hundred thousand accounts. Having this automation tool is the best for marketing management and organization.

all_reviews.review_title: Horrible tool after IBM bought out Silverpop
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Silverpop did have a few great features. One of those being the customization dashboard and the ability to see what was scheduled to go out and when. Another great feature was the spam scan it would perform on the html email to let the user know if there was anything really off with the email.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
I, and the rest of the marketing team, didn't like that the tool wouldn't sent out our emails, even if we set the email up with enough time to let the query run before the send time. Some of the emails we had scheduled would have to be unscheduled and never be sent because after 12-14 hours they still hadn't set and were time sensitive.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
In all honestly, we solved a lot of business problems by not renewing out contract with Silverpop.

all_reviews.review_title: Good program, occasionally gets backed up
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
The ease of use for people inexperienced in HTML. Allows you to fairly easily edit email templates. I liked the ability to filter the audience based on a larger number of criteria such as location, optin date, donation amounts, etc.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
The program pretty often got backed up and email tests would not go through. Being unable to suppress single or small number of emails without importing them as a suppression list.
Not being able to easily resend email tests without having to go through several steps such as choosing the test list again and adding additional send information.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
I would recommend that others that IBM Marketing Cloud is a good product but would recommend that they use it for a while to get used to it before they complain to tech support or consider switching to another program, the software frequently updates to make it more user friendly.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
I was sending out campaign fundraising emails to specific audiences. Was able to create a query based audience, filtering by last donation date, geographic location, or even email system they use.

all_reviews.review_title: It does what we need it to do, but it has its issues
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
IBM Marketing Cloud (or SilverPop) is a great tool that allows you to manage users in a database and is a great tool that allows you to email your users pretty easily.  It has query tools that allow you to send emails to segmented groups of users so you can really target your emails to specific clients.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
A few times now we've had an issue and when we called in for support it was an open case/bug that IBM was working on, but they neglected to notify anyone about.    While it's great that we could get in contact with them, they could use some improvements on the client contact side.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
IBM Marketing Cloud has its quirks that seem a bit tedious to work with, but once you get past the quirks it really is a great tool that allows you to manage your email subscriptions simply and allows you to build and send emails.

One of the nicer features is that any hyperlinks added into your emails can be tracked so you can see analytics beyond opens and clicks.  You can see what percent of users clicked on each specific link.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are primarily using SilverPop to manage our email list and to send emails.  It's great because we can have users manage their email preferences and the database will automatically update based on the info they add it.  It really cuts back on the database management work and we can even add preferences to further segment users on the user preferences screens that you can setup within the tool.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
- Ease of use
- Split view
- Test mailing feature
- The option to view what your mailing will look like if you were on a mobile device or tablet
- The option to merge data fields, and queries
- The option to schedule mailings
- The option to track who opened the email and hyperlinks in the emails
- User friendly
- Great interface
- Everyone can access the mailing that their colleaue worked on.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
- Can't paste pictures
- Sometimes my mailings won't save so I have to start over
- Sometimes its hard to move things around in your mailing
- Its not easy to remove hyperlnks

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
It does jut about everything you need it to do for email marketing and then some. It also integrates with 123Signup to pull our members to make our queries. So its easy to find out marketing targets. Making the queries is a little complicated, but I would recommend silvepop.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
The silvepop mailings help drive attendance to our events. The mailings are very interactive and user friendly for our members. We can put all the info, pics and links that they need in one mailing.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
This is a good marketing automation tool if you learn how to use it. I use it to send email campaigns and to track my progress with its reporting options. It has everything you could need for marketing automation.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
I wish they offered a big library of templates and images for people who can't create them or have a team to do so.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Take the time to learn how to use it, and it will be helpful to you.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We do drip campaigns using this tool to communicate with customers and prospective customers. We also reference their metrics for reporting purposes to our leadership.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
It's a powerful tool that let's you do all sorts of tracking, analytics, designing, and so much more. It is great for email marketing, to manage your contacts and create/ schedule mailings the way you want it to. I liked that is really easy to change minor design adaptions inside the dashboard. You are able to show your draft as is or in HTML code. You can add a tone of automated information, starting with name/ greeting to unsubscribe messages.

I really like that you can export to excel and even import from CVS. Makes mass adding contact information very easy.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
It is very complex. Without a proper training you will never be able to do more than just the basic things. If you have more than one user account you need to pay extra for specific features (e.g. if you want to include more than one database to your engagement automation).

If you have a huge contact data base managing all these contacts is rather difficult. I exported them to Excel (which is actually a really nice feature) and manually changed entries.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Take the time and really learn how the email automation works. It's worth it!

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
I used Silverpop for email marketing and managed my contacts with it as well. But our company was split into two departments, thus I sometimes had issues with using features they already blocked (and the company didn't want to pat for twice).

As my job responsibilities changed, I'm not using Silverpop anymore.

all_reviews.review_title: I use Silverpop to monitor email performance
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Silverpop houses all my email data in one place and I like the level of granularity that it provides.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
The interface can be confusing to navigate at first. The tabs to navigate are small and aren't intuitive. The user flow isn't as smooth as it could be. I often use load the site in Firefox and sometimes it crashes my browser. It can be slow to load data, but sometimes data loads more quickly. The loading speed can vary from time to time.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Although Silverpop's interface can be slow to load online and difficult to navigate, I think the kinds of information Silverpop provides is very useful. If IBM continues to improve the user experience, I would recommend this product to advertisers looking for email marketing analytics solutions

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
Silverpop helps my team see email performance and better understand the kinds of communications our consumers are most interested in.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
The automation seems as if it could be used for almost anything.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
What they don't tell you is that to use the automation and segmentation you need to either have a full time coder at your disposal or be ready to shell out thousands more for the facilities they sell you on at the beginning.

Although I have not spoken to a rude member of staff once, the customer service is horrendous. If you have a problem you can be waiting weeks for an answer. A simple database issue took 2 weeks to diagnose and still waiting for the fix. Whereas I have been waiting just under 2 weeks for a price for an upgrade so that I can use the automation to the best of its capability. All I have had back is a slide show about what I have asked for. Very poor customer experience for the amount Silverpop charge.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Don't do it. We are currently evaluating other options that provide the same level of expertise but for a fraction of the cost and better support!

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have multiple stores and want to automate as much of our customer contact as possible. This could be possible with Silverpop but only if you pay through your nose (Quoted $42,000 a year extra).

all_reviews.review_title: Not recommended for automation,  worst email marketing tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
There is nothing that we should like in silverpop. It has very basic functionality that a simple email tool have but it also lack the very basic functionality of a email tool for eg. changing time of a scheduled campaign.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
1. Automation of campaign is complicated and time consuming.
2. You Cannot reschedule a campaign. You have to unscheduled a campaign and do the complete process again. Every simple email marketing tool have this function that a scheduled campaign time can be changed but not in silverpop. You have to go through the same process of creating and scheduling a campaign again.
3. You cannot make changes in a automated campaigns. You have to cancel that automation and then again do the same process. Automation is meant to decrease the work load and optimize the automated campaign by changing the subject line, small changes in content etc. But you cannot do that in silverpop.
4. You cannot make any changes in a scheudled campaign, Like changing subject line, content etc.
5. Loading time. On every step of silverpop you will have to wait and see the pop ups and progress bar coming in. That is frustrating and irritating.
6. Email deliverability - They does not take care of IPs, they will give you IPs to handle yourself, You have assign the ips yourself to each and every query and segments you create. An inexperienced person who is new to email marketing may spoil the IP and domain reputation.
7. Support - support team takes there own time to answer your request and their support is not available on saturdays and sunday.
8. Report tabs. If you have a large database and you have already done many campaigns then report tab will not load at all. It will keep on loading and suddenly it will show unexpected error occurred.



Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
If you want to automate your email marketing, Recommendation campaigns etc. Do not go for silverpop at all. Even if you want to use silverpop as a bulk email marketing tool then also I will not recommend it because the deliverability team of Silverpop is not experienced and they will let you handle your IPs which is dangerous. Even if you go for 5-6 IPs for your organization they will not rotate the IPs, You will have to manually assign the IPs to each and every query. But they will pool the ip for rotation if you insist.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have been into email marketing from last 7 years and have used N number of tools but this is the worst tool I have worked on. It is complicated, time consuming and irritating tool where you will see pop ups, progress bars every now and then. I would not recommend this tool at all. If you want to save your time and money.

all_reviews.review_title: Long Time Silverpop User - from Engage B2B to IBM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
I've worked with many platforms from MailChimp to Pardot. Silverpop is a very dynamic marketing automation tool. It has all the features that you need to run a simple marketing campaign to automated complex behavior marketing programs. Silverpop has a very active user community that allows users to share ideas, flag bugs, put in support cases, and suggest new functionality for the development road map.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
The tool does not integrate with some popular 3rd party tools and the inbound and landing page reporting capabilities are not as strong as they can be. The interface can be challenging to navigate for new users and some of the org administrative functions and setup can be a bit confusing. The interface user experience has been greatly improved from the Engage B2B days as well as the functionality.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Choosing the right platform is a very important business decision. When choosing a platform you have to consider not only if the platform is right for you, but also if you are right for the platform. Do you have the internal resources needed to learn and utilize all of Silverpops functionality? Do you have the data to support the use of some of the more advanced features. If you have a database with less than 2,500 contacts and no database fields to use to create targeted queries and lists then you should consider a cheaper tool so you are not paying for functionality you will not be able to use.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
Making sure that the right audience gets the right message at the right time is essential to digital marketing. Having the right data and the right platform can make all the difference. I've worked with clients that were sending e-blasts to their entire database and worked with them to utilize the data that they had and Silverpops features to make their outbound digital marketing more targeted and effective. From website behavioral data, relational table data, web forms, and landing pages - you are able to track behaviors and collect data all in your Silverpop org. This allows you to send automated but also personalized outbound messaging to the right contact at the right time.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Silverpop's interface is extremely user friendly. With quick training, most people should be able to create, send and measure an email. For more advanced users, the automated programs and reporting features are very accessible without compromising on power or insight.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
If you have a problem that requires advanced information, it can be hard to get a real response. They tend to give canned answers to problems. If you can get to someone more technical though, they're great.

What problems is Acoustic Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
Silvepop makes it very easy to create attractive transactional emails, and they have tons of third party partners, so even if they don't have everything you want, you can find a solution that integrates easily.

review_question_answers.answer: Silvepop makes it very easy to create attractive transactional emails, and they have tons of third party partners, so even if they don't have everything you want, you can find a solution that integrates easily.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Ability to set up email campaigns and not have to think twice about them. Also, being able to test multiple templates, subject lines, from names takes the guessing out of knowing which type of email will appeal to the email recipients.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
Interface is a bit hard to work with, and it feels like more of an email tool, than an overall digital marketing suite (unless you purchase the plug-ins). We don't have instance access to our data, which makes creating automated campaigns a bit difficult. Also, our plug-in with EpiServer has never worked properly.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Great for use with companies that have instance access to marketing data.

The forms are a great added bonus. Send time optimization has also been helpful with open rates and click-throughs... better than a mass send.

all_reviews.review_title: One of the best email-centric platforms currently available
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
I can easily manage a large number of users while keeping an eye on deliverability.  There are a lot of "securities" in place to force deliverability best practices.  I can easily send emails in 30 different languages with no problems.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
As many have mentioned, the UI is dated and needs help. Silverpop is aware and slowly rolling out improvements.  A lot of focus seems to be on adding new functionality and new "apps" over addressing some of the usability problems of the core features of the software.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Engage is a great tool with a lot of advanced features to really help you focus on your targeted audience and make informed decisions.  It has a well-documented API to allow you to take advantage of a lot of the functionality of Engage in your own applications/websites.  After personally reviewing Eloqua and ExactTarget, Silverpop was attractive not only from a feature set, but from a pricing perspective as well.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent ability to handle large databases, not automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Silverpop is great for large companies that need multiple database integration and excellent deliverability of email. Social is built right into their emails so sharing is easy for recipients plus they have the ability to allow form fills with social sign-in.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
The automation side of Silverpop is lacking. It's difficult to use programs and the integration to Salesforce.com isn't robust enough to create fully automated marketing campaigns. It's hard to use their analytics to make decisions about future campaigns.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
This system is best suited for B2C companies looking to send large email campaigns.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Silverpop offers a few slick features like Send Time Optimization which some other systems don't offer yet.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
I've used Silverpop in two instances. Once back when it was still Vtrenz/Engage B2B and then in 2012 on the Engage 8 platform. In my opinion the old platform was much better than the current. I found the system cumbersome and with a bad UI. I was shocked to see how hard it was to pull reports and export more than 100 contacts from a query. When I looked for helpful resources I came up short. I only used it for about 4 months while we were moving to a different automation system and the move couldn't have come soon enough.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Look elsewhere.
