reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Head of Marketing Operations for Duo

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Vanity URLs for landing pages, deliverability of emails, ability to store lots of data, forward to a friend tracking was a cool feature!

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
It was a cumbersome user experience. The marketing automation wasn't what we needed, and the customer support was slow to respond to our questions. It was too expensive for our needs and the size of our CRM. Salesforce integration was lacking.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
If you are an in-house marketing team with beginner or no coding capacity, this isn't for you. The WYSIWYG capabilities for building email templates and landing pages is messy, and would be helpful with built in templates. If you have over 50K in contacts, the database functions may be helpful.

Overall, I truly found the experience to be slow and constantly found myself telling my execs that Silverpop had messed one thing or another up, after checking for user error, of course! ;)

all_reviews.review_title: Good email marketing tool, bad automation tool.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
The email functionality of Silverpop is very robust: email to friend, dynamic content, personalization, etc. Also, A/B testing with Silverpop is easier than it is with Marketo.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
The integration with Salesforce is not good. It is manual and hard to maintain. For example, choosing which fields to map over and setting up rules for every field is quite tedious. Additionally, the interface is not as intuitive as the drag-and-drop of other tools I've seen.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
The integration with Salesforce is quite manual, at least from when I last used it back in 2011. If you have the time and resources to set it up right at the onset, Silverpop may be worth considering. Otherwise, I would recommend looking into other tools such as a Marketo or Eloqua because I think they have more advanced functionalities and a far better integration with Salesforce.

all_reviews.review_title: Silverpop integration with SalesForce and HTML Design Templates - Satisfactory
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
The ESP was efficient with A/B testing and sending out mass campaigns up to 20,00 emails without any scheduling issues. Integrated with CRM unlimited amount of contacts and accounts for email sends.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
Not user-friendly ESP, there was minimal training by customer service team. Too many functionalities for deployment, design, integration, reporting, list segmentation. The integration with SalesForce is not real-time as it updates in a nightly process for email history, opens, clicks and conversions. There are also no pre-designed templates HTML to customize. All templates need to be designed from Dreamweaver then uploaded into Silverpop, adding more time to email process.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Factor in training, # of email sends per day, Integration with CRM, Ease of use and automation.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
The Silverpop Engage programs interface is intuitive and easy to use.  We were able to setup a fairly complex branching nurture program in short order.  The html import capability has enabled us to work directly with our graphic designer to achieve the exact look desired for communications.  Send Time Optimization and Forward to a Friend are terrific value adds to our communications.  Deliverability can't be beat. We are currently employing a basic scoring model but very excited to explore this capability more.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
The GUI could benefit from more on screen/in-line prompts, especially for some of the more advanced features.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
Take full advantage of their training. It really helped to shorten the learning curve for the newest members of our marketing team.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Training and support is very good. They provide great training videos to help you with any problem, and the Silverpop certification is a useful and unique thing to have

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
Cumbersome and out of date. After using programs like Bronto and seeing the capabilities of Responsys and Yesmail, Silverpop is clearly behind on both technology, usability and UI. NOTE: I used this program from 2011 to 2012

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
NOT for small businesses that need pre-made templates. This is for enterprise only companies that have dedicated graphic designers and coders that can produce full HTML coded emails from scratch.

NOT for large ecommerce companies with millions of people on their lists and the need for advanced segmentation and intelligent customer emails. YES, it has the capability but this is where they fall behind Responsys and Yesmail.

FOR medium sized companies with 50K to 500K contacts with a full coding and email design department and minimal email intelligence needs.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
review_question_answers.answer: Training and support is very good. They provide great training videos to help you with any problem, and the Silverpop certification is a useful and unique thing to have

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
review_question_answers.answer: Cumbersome and out of date. After using programs like Bronto and seeing the capabilities of Responsys and Yesmail, Silverpop is clearly behind on both technology, usability and UI. NOTE: I used this program from 2011 to 2012

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful solution for B2B and B2C brands
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Acoustic Campaign?
Email deliverability is outstanding. Send Time Optimizer (STO) takes the guess work as to when to send an email to a user (uses past behavior to estimate best hour/day to send email). Relational Table functionality makes system extremely scalable -- especially for loyalty programs.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
User interface is a dated - Some items are not intuitive. Takes a bit of time to get full trained.

Recommendations to others considering Acoustic Campaign:
One of the best solutions for B2C customers.

What do you dislike about Acoustic Campaign?
Silverpop may need a China ISP-relationship manager to iron out the deliverability in China, i.e. establish relationship with major key email clients are very important.
